title: STRchive-loci
citation_format: In text: [@pmid:20560987; @pmid:26220009], individual citations in a list: [pmid:20560987, pmid:26220009]

id.title: ID
id.description: Unique identifier for the locus within STRchive in the form [disease_id]_[gene]. Additional characters may be added to the end of the ID to make it unique within STRchive, e.g. HFG_HOXA13-I, HFG_HOXA13-II

chrom.title: Chromosome
chrom.description: Chromosome name, assumed to be the same for all reference genomes

start_hg38.title: Start (hg38)
start_hg38.description: Start position in hg38 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_hg38.title: Stop (hg38)
stop_hg38.description: Stop position in hg38 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

start_hg19.title: Start (hg19)
start_hg19.description: Start position in hg19 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_hg19.title: Stop (hg19)
stop_hg19.description: Stop position in hg19 reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

start_t2t.title: Start (T2T)
start_t2t.description: Start position in chm13-T2T reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

stop_t2t.title: Stop (T2T)
stop_t2t.description: Stop position in chm13-T2T reference genome. Coordinates are BED style: 0-based, half-open.

disease_description.title: Disease Description
disease_description.description: Description of the disease with citations
examples: Sensory disturbances, imbalance, oscillopsia, chronic dry cough, dysarthria and dysphagia [@pmid:38876750]

prevalence.title: Prevalence
prevalence.description: Prevalence of the disease as a fraction

prevalence_details.title: Prevalence Details
prevalence_details.description: Details about the prevalence of the disease including affected populations and citations in the format [@pmid:38467784]

age_onset.title: Age of Onset
age_onset.description: Description of the age of onset of the disease with citations

age_onset_min.title: Min Age Onset
age_onset_min.description: Minimum age of onset reported in the literature (years)

age_onset_max.title: Max Age Onset
age_onset_max.description: Maximum age of onset reported in the literature (years)

typ_age_onset_min.title: Min Typical Age Onset
typ_age_onset_min.description: Minimum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literature (years)

typ_age_onset_max.title: Max Typical Age Onset
typ_age_onset_max.description: Maximum of the typical age of onset range reported in the literature (years)

details.title: Details
details.description: Detailed information about the repeat locus and evidence for pathogenicity, with citations in the format [@pmid:38467784]. This could include information about motifs, interruptions, and other features of the repeat.

mechanism_detail.title: Mechanism Detail
mechanism_detail.description: Detailed mechanism of disease with citations

year.title: Year
year.description: Year of first publication of the tandem repeat disease locus with citations

location_in_gene.title: Location in Gene
location_in_gene.description: Location of the repeat locus in the gene or relative to other genomic features

gene_strand.title: Gene Strand
gene_strand.description: Direction of gene transcription relative to reference genome

reference_motif_reference_orientation.title: Reference Motif (Reference Orientation)
reference_motif_reference_orientation.description: Motif in the reference genome in the + reference orientation (regardless of if it is pathogenic)

pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation.title: Pathogenic Motif (Reference Orientation)
pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the + reference orientation. May be the same as the reference motif if it is pathogenic when expanded or contracted.

benign_motif_reference_orientation.title: Benign Motif (Reference Orientation)
benign_motif_reference_orientation.description: Benign motif(s) in the + reference orientation. Benign motifs are not known to be pathogenic at any size. May be the same as the reference motif if it is benign.

unknown_motif_reference_orientation.title: Unknown Motif (Reference Orientation)
unknown_motif_reference_orientation.description: Motif(s) of unknown consequence in the + reference orientation. Only include motifs that have been observed in individuals but are not classified elsewhere.

pathogenic_motif_gene_orientation.title: Pathogenic Motif (Gene Orientation)
pathogenic_motif_gene_orientation.description: Pathogenic motif(s) in the gene orientation, so the reverse complement if gene is on - strand. Automatically generated from pathogenic_motif_reference_orientation and gene_strand.

benign_motif_gene_orientation.title: Benign Motif (Gene Orientation)
benign_motif_gene_orientation.description: Benign motif(s) in the gene orientation, so the reverse complement if gene is on - strand. Automatically generated from benign_motif_reference_orientation and gene_strand.

unknown_motif_gene_orientation.title: Unknown Motif (Gene Orientation)
unknown_motif_gene_orientation.description: Motif(s) of unknown consequence in the gene orientation, so the reverse complement if gene is on - strand. Automatically generated from unknown_motif_reference_orientation and gene_strand.

locus_structure.title: Locus Structure
locus_structure.description: Structure of the locus including the order of motifs and any interruptions. Only one motif can have a null count. If this is missing it will be inferred to be a simple repeat based on the first reference motif.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of motif in the locus structure

enum_descriptions.pathogenic_repeat: The pathogenic_repeat will typically have a count of null.
enum_descriptions.flank_repeat: Must be outside the locus coordinates. The order in the json will be used to determine the location. For example, if it occurs before the pathogenic repeat, it will be considered 5' flanking. These are expected to be present in the reference genome.
enum_descriptions.internal_repeat: A repeat that is located within the locus coordinates. It may occur in only some alleles and may be absent from the reference genome.
enum_descriptions.interruption: A non-repetitive interruption in the repeat structure, e.g. an insertion that doesn't match the surrounding motif. Must be within the locus coordinates.

benign_min.title: Benign Min
benign_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range

benign_max.title: Benign Max
benign_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the benign (normal) range

intermediate_min.title: Intermediate Min
intermediate_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the intermediate range

intermediate_max.title: Intermediate Max
intermediate_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the intermediate range

pathogenic_min.title: Pathogenic Min
pathogenic_min.description: Minimum number of repeats in the pathogenic range

pathogenic_max.title: Pathogenic Max
pathogenic_max.description: Maximum number of repeats in the pathogenic range

motif_len.title: Motif Length
motif_len.description: Length of the first pathogenic motif in base pairs

ref_copies.title: Reference Copies
ref_copies.description: Number of reference motif copies in the hg38 reference genome

novel.title: Novel
novel.description: If the pathogenic motif is in the hg38 reference genome, ref, otherwise, novel

gnomad.title: gnomAD
gnomad.description: gnomAD ID(s) for the gene, typically the gene ID

stripy.title: STRIpy
stripy.description: STRIpy ID(s) for the disease, typically the gene ID

tr_atlas.title: Tandem Repeat Atlas
tr_atlas.description: Tandem Repeat Atlas ID(s) for the locus

webstr_hg38.title: WebSTR
webstr_hg38.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg38

webstr_hg19.title: WebSTR
webstr_hg19.description: WebSTR ID(s) for the locus in hg19

locus_tags.title: Locus Tags
locus_tags.description: Tags for the locus, used for grouping similar loci and for flagging loci with specific characteristics. Should be snake_case (lower case with underscores) and not contain spaces or special characters. Some tags have specific meanings, such as sparse_evidence for loci with < 5 independent cases after 5 years of publication, or conflicting_evidence for loci where there is evidence for and against pathogenicity in the literature resulting in concern that the locus may not be pathogenic.

disease_tags.title: Disease Tags
disease_tags.description: Tags for the disease, used for grouping similar diseases and for flagging diseases with specific characteristics. Should be snake_case (lower case with underscores) and not contain spaces or special characters.

references.title: References
references.description: All references from the fields above. Automatically generated from all in-text citations.

additional_literature.title: Additional Literature
additional_literature.description: Additional literature related to this locus in the format. Should not be included in the references field. Automatically generated from scripts that search the literature.
